lines.text: I missed the city once, Jane. I missed the rush and the color, and the sight of women so beautiful in their dresses and high heels. Then I looked at this jungle, at the birds and the trees, the ground so alive beneath me, and I realized that out here in the middle of nowhere, in a place not even on the map... I was closer to God.
Okay, how do I explain this? When you're a star, everybody knows you.
Jane, Roger, Cheetah...
No, no, no, Tarzan, I mean everybody all around the world. You're in the newspaper every day, you're on TV every day, you sign autographs.
Autographs?
Yeah, you write your name on a piece of paper.
Why?
Because you're famous! Because everybody wants a piece of you. That's what makes them happy.
The sun makes people happy. Trees make people happy. Why does a piece of paper make people happy?
[pause]
I'll have to get back to you on that.
Jane is very stubborn.
I had a good teacher.
I have to dig a what?
A trench. T-R-E...
I know how to spell it, you goon.
You know, someday, you're going to have to start reading something other than airplane manuals.
Okay, Great Wizard of the Book.
[Roger and Simon are arguing over Roger's loud music]
I happen to know that Albert Schweitzer listened to loud music.
Albert Schweitzer never listened to music that loud.
Yeah? How do you know?
Because he won the Nobel PEACE Prize.
[Long pause]
That... is the most logical thing I've ever heard.
Somebody explain to me why I live in a house with no walls in the middle of monsoon territory.
The rent's cheap?
Oh, yeah. I knew it was something.
You're sure you've never heard of me?
Tarzan is sure.
What, you don't have a CD player? Okay, a radio? Now come on, you must watch videos!
Tarzan watches the jungle. That is enough.
I don't understand. I'm supposed to be a household name.
I guess that doesn't cover treehouses.
[after a crash]
Where's my Jeep?
Jane's Jeep became good friends with a tree.
It did, huh?... Okay.
Sometimes Jane's mind works so hard that her eyes do not see.
And what is that supposed to...
[Jane trips on a rock and falls]
Jane made Tarzan's point.
Ha ha.
Jane Porter never did anything because of a man.
In Tarzan's jungle, it is more important to protect the living than to protect memories.
You could have told me there was water nearby before I made a fool of myself.
Jane is not a fool. Just wrong.
[about his parents]
They died, Tarzan lived. Why?
The jungle needed you.
I wouldn't go out there for all the cars in Detroit!
How do you always make everything so simple?
Practice.
